title: Studying but still getting bad grades, what do I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m not sure how old you are, but I’d guess high school age. The most common reasons for people getting lower marks than before, Changing from Grade 8 to High School Mental health issues, like depression Not getting enough regular sleep Starting to use drugs and/or alcohol. Hanging out with a crowd that don't study and think it’s not cool. Physical illness doesn’t sound like a problem with you If you are studying hard and still not achieving can you look at the things mentioned and see if any apply. Especially clinical depression. It’s common in teen agers. Is this year presenting harder subjects and you are struggling with content? Go and talk to student services and see if they can help. They may be able to suggest other learning skills. Are you able to tell your parents that you are trying, but don't seem to be able to get good marks? They may think you are still goofing off It seems important that you now feel happy as life is now. What is it about this situation that makes you happy? If you are still working hard and have low grades and are happy, that’s unusual. Do you have any idea what you want to do WRT work when you are an adult? If college is on the cards then obviously things have to improve. Speak to your teachers and ask where they think you are missing out. Speak to student services and ask your parents if you can get a basic health check.

First thing is for you to do a Quora search on the topic of Study. There have been a very large number of questions posted, most of which ask essentially what you have asked here. With just a little work from you, you will find hundreds and hundreds of answers to your questions. Along with many comments about immature kids retreating from responsibility and letting their grades crater, but feeling good about it because it is so comfortable to avoid the tasks you are supposed to fulfill. And the serious consequences you face if you continue to act in a childlike manner.
